Module dev.kkorolyov.pancake.core
Package dev.kkorolyov.pancake.core.component

Interface Joint.Constraint

Enclosing class:
Joint
Functional Interface:
This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.
@FunctionalInterface public static interface Joint.Constraint
Ensures that 2 joints maintain some specific relation to each other.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    apply(dev.kkorolyov.pancake.platform.entity.Entity a, dev.kkorolyov.pancake.platform.entity.Entity b)
    Checks if joints a and b adhere to this constraint.
    static Joint.Constraint
    force(double min, double max, double strength, Comparator<dev.kkorolyov.pancake.platform.entity.Entity> targeter)
    Adds temporary forces to joints selected by targeter to be within min and max (inclusive) Euclidean distance of each other.

    Repositions joints selected by targeter to be within min and max (inclusive) Euclidean distance of each other.

  • Method Details

    • reposition

      static Joint.Constraint reposition(double min, double max, Comparator<dev.kkorolyov.pancake.platform.entity.Entity> targeter)
      Repositions joints selected by targeter to be within min and max (inclusive) Euclidean distance of each other. If targeter returns < 0, modifies the first joint; if > 0, modifies the second joint; if 0, modifies both joints equally in opposite directions. Assumes both joints have a Transform.

    • force

      static Joint.Constraint force(double min, double max, double strength, Comparator<dev.kkorolyov.pancake.platform.entity.Entity> targeter)
      Adds temporary forces to joints selected by targeter to be within min and max (inclusive) Euclidean distance of each other. If targeter returns < 0, modifies the first joint; if > 0, modifies the second joint; if 0, modifies both joints equally in opposite directions. Force is calculated by scaling the found MTV by strength - e.g. if the joints are 2 units further apart past the max, force added is 2 * strength. Assumes both joints have a Transform, Force, and ActionQueue.

    • apply

      void apply(dev.kkorolyov.pancake.platform.entity.Entity a, dev.kkorolyov.pancake.platform.entity.Entity b)
      Checks if joints a and b adhere to this constraint. If they do not, applies some remediation operation to the joints to fix. a is the entity owning the invoked Joint component, and b is the constrained joint.
